senses.sense_definition: Провести много времени, толкаясь в тесноте или толпе; устать от толкотни.

examples.text: Я так <натолкался> в утреннем автобусе, что теперь у меня нет сил идти гулять.

target_lang_translations.en: I <got so jostled around> on the morning bus that now I have no energy to go for a walk.

examples.text: Мы изрядно <натолкались> в очереди за билетами, но всё-таки попали на концерт.

target_lang_translations.en: We <had our fair share of pushing and shoving> in the ticket line, but we still made it to the concert.

target_lang_definitions.en: To spend a lot of time pushing and shoving in a crowd or tight space; to get tired or fed up with the jostling.

en.target_lang_sense_clarification: to become exhausted from the physical struggle in a crowd

en.target_lang_word: have one's fill of pushing and shoving
en.target_lang_sense_clarification: idiomatic, implying one has done it enough to be sick of it

en.target_lang_word: get worn out from the crush
en.target_lang_sense_clarification: focusing on the exhaustion caused by a crowded space
